content: STAY AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY! The product disconnects and requires you to go back through the entire setup process again. The return process is terrible and requires a fight.

Doesn't work, don't know why. Google Play & Roost website both said it was compatible with my device, so I installed it, but as soon as I try to open/click on icon an error box pops up saying 'Roost has stopped'. Can't do anything with it, so Roost devices a waste of money.
Klugy setup
difficult
Very confusing

Internet Hog! Don't bother trying to use the internet for anything while these are installed. Between the app and the devices, no one else could hardly use the internet! And we usually have 5 to 10 devices using internet at any given time, so our internet is not the problem.

This app can be used only if you provide your or in the case of installing on a tablet, someone else's, cell phone number. There's absolutely no legitimate business reason why you have to give a phone number to register the app. An email address should suffice. It just a scam to harvest phone numbers and should be illegal. Companies like this have been emboldened to intrude on our privacy since people share their personal information willy-nilly.

Can't login. The app used to work, wanted to see if my smoke detectors are fine but when I try to login I get some firebase auth error. It used to work on this device, tried rebooting and reinstalling but nothing helped.
PEACE OF MIND!
OK unless you want you uninstall. Worthless

4/20/20: The app is just as bad as it always has been. I cannot recommend any products from this company if they can't get the simplest piece of the puzzle engineered correctly in ~3 years. Update 5/3/18: This app is still garbage quality. Get a real Product Manager and developers. What the hell is wrong with you guys? Why aren't you using sso to sign up and delegations to secondary SSOs as managers and alert recipients? Learn that from the Google WiFi app. This app is also full of cheap web wrappers.
Roost has updated the app to allow monitoring other households. This is important so I can monitor my families other homes. I will update my review when I confirm everytime works correctly.
Fixed the problem with no notification after the initial one. Multiple emails describing the problem and details helped them figure it out. Now the app is useful again!

Using to monitor for leaks. It's a great idea, is fairly easy to install, but the app interface is incredibly frustrating. It often tells me there are alerts, but information on what the alert is, or what the alert symbols mean, is not shown anywhere. Seems to miss the point on the one feature actually needed. Also randomly logs me out so I then get no notifications of any kind until I realize I haven't heard from it in awhile.
Doesn't work. Won't connect devices to network.

Unreliable. Lots of false alarms from other loud noises picked up by the battery. No firmware updates possible so beware that they might become unusable at any point when Roost decide to change the Roost cloud connection. 2 of mine did after a year. Very expensive plain batteries now.

Pure junk. Support accepts no responsibility for terribly poor product line. Blames their customers for their faulty products and refuses to provide full refunds. Save your money and avoid this scam at all costs.

Junk. I chatted with their customer service, followed the troubleshooting steps and with all of that it literally has never worked. On top of that, it's been 2 years since I got the battery, it hasn't been in a smoke detector (since it doesn't work in one) and somehow the battery is dead and won't even reset.
Three out the four batteries have failed in just over two years. I will not be investing in more.

Alerts do not send any notification, neither a text message nor an alert. This has been the case since day one. When I hit 'Test' notification the alert sounds ironically. Once this is fixed I will update my review and rating.

Tried setting up my leak detector countless times over many months. Despite the effort, the device only managed 2 check-ins total. Setup was cumbersome, and the app often redirected to my web browser. Only satisfaction I got was when I took a sledgehammer to it.
it states App installed open in playstore but will not open.
It needs more customization options when it comes to alerts. otherwise works well.

I am testing with two batteries. One smoke detector and one carbon monoxide detector are located within 10 feet of each other. My initial testing is showing that even when the alarms are located this close, the notifications are coming from the correct alarm. The ability to custom name batteries it's great, because the battery can be used for water alarms, smoke, motion, CO detectors. Need ability to pair to multiple Wi-Fi routers and to notify multiple emails and SMS numbers. Need in Canada!
App is great. For install use the "sound" setup if available, it's a snap. Recommend Roost change the install process to use that method first.

Product was not easy to set up with my Android version 9, Moto X4. However, I was surprised by roost's tech support. They were committed to helping me get it synced to my phone. Once I exhausted the standard tech support online amd email services, they set up a live phone call with tech support and we were able to resolve the issue. I did have to temporarily allow location to sync and temporarily allow contacts to add a second phone as a monitor. Then I turned off in permissions.
I can't even download it. Just get "unable to reach the server". Doesn't bode well for this system actually working.
creating new account, says all emails I try are invalid. They are not so what's up?

No notifications, what's the point. Just installed new device and app and I don't get notifications for either temp nor relative humidity so what's the point of the app. In addition, I only see weekly chart, but all your other updates on your website show daily so are we losing functionality?
30mb seems quite a lot given the limited scope of this app. (I don't have a problem with the app, but have to wonder why it's so large)

The app is ok. Roost itself is getting worse. I use it for garage door position. It will randomly warn me the door is up when it isn't. It wasn't like that before and has been happening more and more. I may have to get rid of this system.
POS
New inbox feature is very helpful!

Being one of the user and a beliver in this product since launch on Kickstarter back on 2015. After 3 years of use, I can conclude thet this product is over-advertised, as not performing as described: -battery lasts 3 and not 5 years , -when adding a battery app took ages to sincronize with the cloud therefore failures expected and restarting process from scratch, - recently no more support for EU or rest of the world, as product is acredited now only for USA and Canada! One of the most disapointed experience, was that recently my teenage daugther forget meal in own, kitchen completly in smoke, and NO alert sounded!

This company does not stand behind its products. New firmware made all old models obsolete. Go with a company that cares enough to provide updates to all customers. Not worth buying only to be locked out of the service due to poor planning on upgrade paths.
Great companion for iSmartAlarm. Works great. Will work with detectors that use batteries other than the 9volt variety. Just tape it to the alarm cover and you have a wireless alarm!!

NOT impressed that you sent me a text message to tell me to update your app - text messages should be for emergency alerts only. I freaked out when I saw a text message from Roost earlier thinking that there was a fire at home, only to find you just wanted me to update the app. Not cool.
Our roost battery is broadcasting outofservice as the WiFi name and I have no idea what to do to fix this.
Works as advertised. No problems.

Not available in my country, basicaly its worthless and really its 
completly stupid

It's a good idea and hope it works. The annoying things is I can only add 
two people to the device. I'd like to add three. Also the wifi setup is 
impossible because when I go to switch to the roost wifi it goes back to 
the home screen of the app and I can't start from there. The wifi also 
doesn't work period

Great product and application. Device set up is unconventional, but easy 
enough by following directions. I have one Roost battery in the house 
interconnected smoke detector near the kitchen. Since the Roost Smart 
Battery "listens" for alarms, it also detects (and appropriately 
identifies) when my separate carbon monoxide and natural gas detectors are 
set off, and of course when any interconnected smoke detector alerts. I 
also have a fire detector with a Roost battery in both my house garage and 
pole barn (smoke detectors are not suitable for unheated spaces, so a fire 
detector that detects and alerts on rate of heat rise is the way to go). 
Lastly, I have a couple Roost water detectors in the basement (one by the 
water heater, and one by the sump pump. I have a separate wifi router in 
the pole barn to support wifi, streaming, and the Roost battery in the fire 
detector. Overall, the system works great. The Roost app is installed on 
every smart device we have (kids & wife's iPhones, an iPad, an Android 
tablet and an Android phone. All alert reliably. Great peace of mind - 
especially when not at home or kids are alone in the house. Fantastic 
investment. We did have a challenge early in the product's launch with 
Android alerting properly. An e-mail to their support brought a prompt 
attentiveness and an app update that they confirmed with us that it 
resolved the problem. Very pleased

Glad you updated it for the garage door sensor, but when will mine 
arrive????

What insurance app? I never signed up for insurance companies? One leak 
detector went off line (Wi-Fi) tried to reconnect but failed. Wifi signal 
is strong. Battery is strong. Tried to set again from scratch. No Wi-Fi 📶 
emitted from device

Update 2018 bugs fixed Used to be a good app. The latest version crashes 
when trying to snooze an alarm. Using Galaxy S7/Marshmallow.
Updated to 4.2.13 today. Empty screen that says roost and the version. No provision to log in.

The app leaves much to be desired. I can tell all their developers have 
iPhones. The biggest improvement would be to list full width detailed 
information on the first screen instead of having to tap on each half width 
battery widget. Also add firmware version and type of detector to the full 
width info widget. A warning of when it's time to replace the detector 
would also be a nice feature. UPDATE: Good looking new app. The problem is 
I always have to login. It constantly says session expired when I open it.
Requires a login. Fail. Complete and utter failure.
Got sensor through my insurance company. Not wasting any more time trying to set it up.

Tried to connect five or six times.  Obviously there's a problem with connecting after reading their tips.  Wouldn't it be better to fix it first before sending out.  Seriously don't have time to keep trying.
Update, the back key now works on Android and I love the new user interface. Very simple and easy to see everything is ok. Good work developers.

Roost devices are some of the simplest and easiest to use home automation products around, and this app couldn't be easier to use. Happy to have useful devices that work well.  AND THE 'BACK' BUTTON NOW WORKS!  YAY!
App is very stupid, not allow to complete registered.
I refuse to pay $15 for a 'replacement' battery pack after the first ones died so soon.

App is pretty bad, can't close it with back button, can only hit the home button. Can't force check for connectivity with battery. Seem like basic functions. Setup for the actual batteries is also difficult, but that's not part of the app.

Really cool device. Couldn't directly connect to the battery's wifi, but the app used its audio communication through my phone's speaker and then it connected fine. I wish though there were more options for the alert. Like a vibrating mode.

Contrary to what other people posted, I find the device & app work very well.   My parents are old and live alone, so this is very helpful for us to keep an eye on their safety.  The notification lags for about 3-4 seconds, but it works every time.
That is some bad app and very bad product. Don"t even bother, could not sync with my wifi.
Works well
Hardware back button is still not supported.  This is embarrassing for an app releases in 2017.
App will not open on Nexus 6P, Nougat 7.1.2 still & here we are in late Sept 2017 with no fix from Roost
App keeps shutting down when I try to see the activity, I've submitted feedback every time I've tried it, frustrating, should uninstall it
Nice and Easy setup. So far so good
Can't even create an account! Keeps saying account in this name already exists...erm, no it doesn't!

App leaves a few things to be desired, back button no longer works on latest version. Overall though a highly reliable product. No false alarms and I've gotten the notifications every time I've burnt toast and forgotten to fan the detector :) Good piece of mind at an appropriate price.

Not getting alerts on my phone. My monitor is getting alerts. Same app version, I have a Nexus 6p and she has a Samsung note 7. The app used to work for me, but now when she burns dinner only her phone goes off, not mine.

Great idea. Roost team are really helpful and do their best to perfect the product.  There are some bugs but overall works well after some initial persistence. PLEASE NOTE Samsung Galaxy S7 fails to set up the battery's for some reason. Just install and run app on another device and problem is solved (for me at least)
Cannot even set it up. Cannot connect to the phone. Will likely return the leak detector.
Batteries don't last more than 18 months.  Both of mine died within 2 year time frame.  Too expensive... Great idea.
Device won't connect to cloud
I am very pleased with the Roost batteries and the support from this company is beyond what can be expected.
Not able to keep app working.  Once done reviewing status and closing it will not work again.  Must go back play open app and retry which leads me to not set up.
Think I've fixed my basement water issue, and with Roost's assist in my leak dector, I'll be able to respond more timely if I haven't. Thanks.
Previous version worked fine
I bought the battery for $35. The app keeps crashing when I try to add a new device. Do you guys give refunds? Can you fix my issue?

When adding a new roost, the smoke alarm manufactured date section doesn't list November or December. After filling out the date, model etc, when you go to view the info, the form is blank. There is also no section to report an issue within the app. Took me 5 tries to pair both of my roosts.
It does everything it's suppose to do, setup was easy

I was skeptical at first but it seems to work just fine. Had the battery for a week now, no false alarms, no issues with setup.  I am concerned about all these "cloud" serviced home automation devices, what if they fail, what happens to my data and will there be a way to continue to operate the device without their service... Only time will tell...  I am going to buy a couple for my moms house so I can keep an eye on her smoke detectors.

Installed in my smoke detectors.  All batteries arrived with not enough charge to keep alarms from beeping, even though app stated they all had full charge.  Replaced with fresh 9Vs from Amazon.  Beeping stopped.
This was just not reliable. I wanted it to work. 1 week old battery was chirping. Replaced with a regular 9 volt and that sure worked. Too bad.

Tooks multiple tries to connect but finally did. It has disconected itself once in the 2 weeks I have had it, but it eventually reconected itself.  Not sure what the message "failed to subscribe push,  device type must be specified in this operation " means.  This pops up every time I open the app. So far as I can tell it is working though.

I'm revising my rating since Roost sent me an updated "Smart Module" and all is working smoothly now.  The connection process was simple, fast, and successful the first time.  This device is ingenious and a potential lifesaver especially if you have pets at home. I'd give it a 5 rating if I didn't have the initial problem with the hardware and unresponsive support.     My prior review follows for reference:  "After initial quick reply from Roost Support I'm getting no response now. I was told that they are

App notifications are completely hit or miss, and it doesn't even bother to tell you when the battery (inevitably) goes offline. The pairing process also seems like it was dreamed up as some sort of practical joke on the user. I would say the only decent thing about the app is it allows you to delete your account with a single button. Thank goodness.
There is no reason this app needs access to all the information it requested. Then to "sign up" for an account, they want more information. Return the battery before you open it.

Simply the battery doesn't fit my smoke alarm. And my smoke alarm has this security feature that you can't close the lid if there is no battery or it's improperly inserted. So I can't use this battery.
6 hours wasted.  Won't connect.  Buggy.  Nope. Nope. Nope.

Took a few attempts to link up to the battery, but eventually did so. Unsure what "Last Activity" is good for as there's no sign of any checking-in. The app also won't allow letters for a UK postal code (AA## #AA format in most cases) which ought to be fixed. Other than that, very clean little app.
Different # of beeps on every attempt
No more 3AM chirps! The app made battery installation super easy, works great!
